pr_title: Issue #7758: Update AbstractChecks to log DetailAST - PackageDeclaration

timeline.message: Issue #7758: Update AbstractChecks to log DetailAST - PackageDeclaration

timeline.bodyText: maybe it's worth keeping this in the code for the comment explaining it?
timeline.author: esilkensen

replies.bodyText: I thought why to use an extra variable, so I removed this.
replies.author: DXTkastb

replies.bodyText: I don’t think it’s a big deal, but probably lean toward keeping the variable and comment in case it makes the code more readable for someone looking at it.
replies.author: esilkensen

timeline.bodyText:
it looks like this can lead to an ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException on empty files - is that a concern?

https://dxtkastb.github.io/checkstyle/reports/packed/diff/hibernate-orm/index.html#A19
https://dxtkastb.github.io/checkstyle/reports/packed/diff/openjdk9/index.html#A38033
timeline.author: esilkensen

replies.bodyText:
Yes, one of the tests for this check is made on the empty java file(with at least one comment). Due to this, Ast goes null and so we are using log(1, 0, MSG_KEY_MISSING);. This points violation on line:1 coumn:1 of the file.
The issue here is empty file can look like:
1.Single line comment in the file
2.Multiline comment
3.Completely empty file..No comment nothing.
The first two cases are covered but if it is completely empty its a problem. I will test this case and revert as soons as possible. Thanks for pointing this out.
replies.author: DXTkastb

replies.bodyText: Maybe in that third case we should fall back on the old way of logging with only a line number rather than throw an exception?
replies.author: esilkensen

replies.bodyText: I think I made a mistake by passing '0' as column number, as I did not pay heed to this empty file scenario. And yes I should probably switch back to old logging way otherwise the exception has to be caught and the method for processing files in Checker.java will need to be changed drastically which is not a wise move.
replies.author: DXTkastb

replies.bodyText: I will do the changes suggested and provide the new diff report shortly. Once again, thanks for the guidance.
replies.author: DXTkastb

replies.bodyText: Sounds good, thanks @DXTkastb!
replies.author: esilkensen

timeline.message: Issue #7758: Update AbstractChecks to log DetailAST - PackageDeclaration
Issue #7758: Update AbstractChecks to log DetailAST - PackageDeclaration

timeline.bodyText: Why does test2 come before test1? Please swap their order.
timeline.author: rnveach

replies.bodyText: done
replies.author: DXTkastb

timeline.bodyText: Indentation looks wrong compared to other test.
timeline.author: rnveach

replies.bodyText: done
replies.author: DXTkastb

timeline.bodyText: @romani ping. It seems to me we need to document this that the check isn't fully xpath compliant.
timeline.author: rnveach

replies.bodyText:
yes, this is exception case.
unfortunately empty java files are valid files by javac:
/var/tmp$ cat Test.java 
/var/tmp$ javac Test.java 
/var/tmp$ echo $?
0

So we have two options:

do not report violation, as at https://checkstyle.org/config_coding.html#PackageDeclaration we all talk about classes, but file is compilation unit, file is not mean class. No classes/types - no violations.
update documentation of Check and Filter  that for such cases user need to use non Xpath suppression.

this code come to us at 2ce3fc4 , as you can see in issue there was no demand for such files to have violation, there was problem with NPE - #1149 .
I suggesting do "2)" now , create separate issue to fix "1)" and do it separately.
@rnveach , if you agree, let do this.
replies.author: romani

replies.bodyText:
I agree with 2. @DXTkastb please make the change. Documentation should be updated in both areas, filter and check.
I agree with 1 if we are moving validation to another Check. If this becomes the case, we can then remove documentation in new issue. @DXTkastb please start the issue.
replies.author: rnveach

replies.bodyText: I am ok to loose this  validation on empty files. Nobody requested it, value of it is very small.
replies.author: romani

replies.bodyText: I have updated the documentation. If anything needs to be changed or added to the documentation please let me know. I have added the screenshots of documentation in the first post.
replies.author: DXTkastb

timeline.author: romani

+ *

+ * Note: + * This Check is partially supported by Xpath Suppression Filters. In case of testing empty + * java files, Xpath Suppression Filters are not supported for this Check. + * (reason at + * PR: #8024)

replies.bodyText: done
replies.author: DXTkastb

timeline.bodyText:
each non-compiled file should have comment like

  
    
      checkstyle/src/it/resources-noncompilable/org/checkstyle/suppressionxpathfilter/packageannotation/SuppressionXpathRegressionPackageAnnotationOne.java
    
    
         Line 1
      in
      513ebd4
    
    
    
    

        
          
           //non-compiled with javac: non-compilable, compiling on jdk before 8 
        
    
  

 to explain a reason.
Please do the same for other Input too.
timeline.author: romani

replies.bodyText: done
replies.author: DXTkastb

replies.bodyText:
non-compilable.

wrong package.
you can make it even more clear - package this.package.mismatch.with.folder
replies.author: romani

replies.bodyText: done.
replies.author: DXTkastb

replies.bodyText:
not a comment .
please make code as package this.package.mismatch.with.folder; // warn
replies.author: romani

replies.bodyText: @romani In that case our checkstyle throws error as it thinks this.package  is unknown token. There is some java parsing problem, probably as these are keyword.
replies.author: DXTkastb

replies.bodyText: my.packagename.mismatch.with.folder
replies.author: romani

replies.bodyText: done
replies.author: DXTkastb
